publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1798 Mr Keith Harding: Award to Kelty Medical Practice—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Royal College of General Practitioners to award its prestigious Quality Practice Award to Kelty Medical Practice in Fife in recognition of the first-class service and high quality of care the practice provides to local patients.
S1M-1798 Award to Kelty Medical Practice (lodged on 27 March 2001) Mr Brian Monteith*

S1M-1798 Mr Keith Harding: Award to Kelty Medical Practice—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Royal College of General Practitioners to award its prestigious Quality Practice Award to Kelty Medical Practice in Fife in recognition of the first-class service and high quality of care the practice provides to local patients. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston*
S1M-1798 Award to Kelty Medical Practice (lodged on 27 March 2001) Tricia Marwick*
S1M-1798 Award to Kelty Medical Practice (lodged on 27 March 2001) Mary Scanlon*, Scott Barrie*
S1M-1798 Award to Kelty Medical Practice (lodged on 27 March 2001) David Mundell*

S1M-1798 Mr Keith Harding: Award to Kelty Medical Practice—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Royal College of General Practitioners to award its prestigious Quality Practice Award to Kelty Medical Practice in Fife in recognition of the first-class service and high quality of care the practice provides to local patients. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston, Tricia Marwick, Mary Scanlon, Scott Barrie, David Mundell
S1M-1798 Award to Kelty Medical Practice (lodged on 27 March 2001) Fergus Ewing*
S1M-1798 Award to Kelty Medical Practice (lodged on 27 March 2001) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*

S1M-1798 Mr Keith Harding: Award to Kelty Medical Practice—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Royal College of General Practitioners to award its prestigious Quality Practice Award to Kelty Medical Practice in Fife in recognition of the first-class service and high quality of care the practice provides to local patients. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston, Tricia Marwick, Mary Scanlon, Scott Barrie, David Mundell, Fergus Ewing, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh

S1M-1798 Mr Keith Harding: Award to Kelty Medical Practice—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Royal College of General Practitioners to award its prestigious Quality Practice Award to Kelty Medical Practice in Fife in recognition of the first-class service and high quality of care the practice provides to local patients. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston, Tricia Marwick, Mary Scanlon, Scott Barrie, David Mundell, Fergus Ewing, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh

S1M-1798 Mr Keith Harding: Award to Kelty Medical Practice—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Royal College of General Practitioners to award its prestigious Quality Practice Award to Kelty Medical Practice in Fife in recognition of the first-class service and high quality of care the practice provides to local patients. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston, Tricia Marwick, Mary Scanlon, Scott Barrie, David Mundell, Fergus Ewing, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh
S1M-1798 Award to Kelty Medical Practice (lodged on 27 March 2001) Mr Jamie McGrigor*

S1M-1798 Mr Keith Harding: Award to Kelty Medical Practice—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Royal College of General Practitioners to award its prestigious Quality Practice Award to Kelty Medical Practice in Fife in recognition of the first-class service and high quality of care the practice provides to local patients. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston, Tricia Marwick, Mary Scanlon, Scott Barrie, David Mundell, Fergus Ewing, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor

S1M-1798 Mr Keith Harding: Award to Kelty Medical Practice—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Royal College of General Practitioners to award its prestigious Quality Practice Award to Kelty Medical Practice in Fife in recognition of the first-class service and high quality of care the practice provides to local patients. Supported by: Mr Brian Monteith, Nick Johnston, Tricia Marwick, Mary Scanlon, Scott Barrie, David Mundell, Fergus Ewing, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, Mr Jamie McGrigor
